jProtocol.Abstract.Model

Class State<T extends ProtocolDataUnit>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jProtocol.Abstract.Model.State<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TlsState

    public abstract class State<T extends ProtocolDataUnit>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      State(StateMachine<T> stateMachine)
      Creates a state for the state machine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onEnter()
      Gets called when this state becomes the current state of a state machine.
      void onLeave()
      Gets called when this state was the current state of a state machine but the current state is changed.
      abstract void receiveMessage(T pdu)
      Gets called when this state is the current state of the state machine and a protocol data unit is received.
      void sendMessage(T pdu)
      Sends a protocol data unit from the state machine.
      void setState(int stateIdentifier)
      Sets the current state in the state machine this state belongs to.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(T pdu)
        Sends a protocol data unit from the state machine.
        Parameters:
        pdu - the protocol data unit

      • setState

        public void setState(int stateIdentifier)
        Sets the current state in the state machine this state belongs to. Must not be called if this state is not the current state.
        Parameters:
        stateIdentifier - the state identifier for the new state

      • receiveMessage

        public abstract void receiveMessage(T pdu)
        Gets called when this state is the current state of the state machine and a protocol data unit is received.
        Parameters:
        pdu - the protocol data unit

      • onEnter

        public void onEnter()
        Gets called when this state becomes the current state of a state machine.

      • onLeave

        public void onLeave()
        Gets called when this state was the current state of a state machine but the current state is changed.
